required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Coronary Syndome With ST Elevation in Northern Lorraine
clinical_study.official_title: Acute Coronary Syndrome With ST Elevation in Northern Lorraine: Evolution of Clinicals, Epidemiological and Angiographic Data Since 2005

brief_summary.textblock: Lorraine is one of the most affected French region by cardiovascular diseases with a mortality rate for ischemic heart disease higher than the national average in 2010. Due to practice change with the new recommandations of the European Society of Cardiology involving the myocardic revascularization, the investigators wanted to compare the Stemi care in 2005-2006, 2010-2011 and 2015 in the CHR Metz-Thionville.

detailed_description.textblock: This monocentric study evaluate the impact of the new recommandations of the European Society of Cardiology in the acute coronary syndrome with ST elevation (Stemi) care. Data is compiled retrospectively from angiographic report and informatic medical record.

primary_outcome.measure: Acute coronary syndrome with ST elevation care
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of per-cutaneous angioplasty and percentage of pre-hospital thrombolysis

secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of manual thrombectomy and percentage of direct stenting
Percentage of death during the STEMI care

study_pop.textblock: Patients with an acute coronary syndrome with ST elevation in the CHR Metz-Thionville in 2005-2006, 2010-2011 and 2015

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient with an acute coronary syndrome with ST elevation for less than 12 hours
- Patients with coronarography in a context of cardiorespiratory arrest with unknown cause and acute coronary occlusion
Exclusion Criteria:
